history.content:
Yes. Found with quick google search:

"Upper Division Requirements

Three upper-division courses in EECS/CS

*CS199, 198, 197, 195, select 194, and various seminars and EE upper divs do not count. If you are unsure, please check with the CS Advisors."

from

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor 

Additionally, the minor form indicates you can use "Upper Division CS/EECS Courses"

from

https://berkeley.app.box.com/v/cs-minor-application

per

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor

Hello! I am planning on doing a minor in CS and currently thinking about which three upper division classes to take. On the CS website it says that "as well as 3 upper division CS courses," so I was wondering if EECS courses fit in the category or not as I am not sure at the moment.
history.subject: EECS classes for CS Minor
